info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 7:11PM PST until January 06 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with up to 8 inches on highway 97 northeast of Interstate 5. * WHERE...Central Siskiyou County, including Klamath River, Yreka, Montague, Weed, Mount Shasta City, Dunsmuir, McCloud, Tennant, Interstate 5, and portions of highways 97, 89, 96, and 3. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult due to snow covered roads and reduced visibilities. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
